Ethnologue > Web version > Country index > Americas > Brazil > Ticuna

Ticuna

A language of Brazil

ISO 639-3: tca

Population  32,600 in Brazil (1998 ISA). Population total all countries: 48,600.
Region  West Amazonas. Also in Colombia, Peru.
Language map  Brazil, reference number 25
Alternate names   Magüta, Tikuna, Tukuna
Classification  Language isolate
Language development  NT: 1986.
Writing system  Latin script.
Comments  SVO.

Also spoken in:

Colombia

Language name   Ticuna
Population  8,000 in Colombia (2000 SIL).
Region  Amazon River.
Language map  Southern Colombia
Alternate names  Tikuna, Tucuna, Tukúna
 

Peru

Language name   Ticuna
Population  8,000 in Peru (2000 SIL).
Region  Northeast Amazon River region, from Chimbote in Peru to San Antonio do Iça in Brazil.
Language map  Peru, reference number 79
Alternate names  Tikuna, Tukuna
Language use  Official language. All ages.
Language development  Literacy rate in L1: 30%–60%. Literacy rate in L2: 25%–50%.
Comments  Christian, traditional religion.
 

Entries from the SIL Bibliography about this language:

Academic Publications

Anderson, Doris G. 1980, 2008. Ticuna conversacional: lecciones para el aprendizaje del idioma.  

Anderson, Doris. 1962. Conversational Ticuna.  

Anderson, Lambert. 1957. "Los ritos de pubertad de los ticuna."

Anderson, Lambert. 1958. "Vocabulario breve del idioma ticuna."

Anderson, Lambert. 1959. "Ticuna vocabulary of minimal tone words (with Portuguese version, Vocabulário tikuna de palavras tonais mínimas)."

Anderson, Lambert. 1959. "Ticuna vowels with special regard to the system of five tonemes = As vogais do tikuna com especial atenção ao sistema de cinco tonemas."

Anderson, Lambert. 1966. "The structure and distribution of Ticuna independent clauses."

Sparing, Margarethe and others. 1976, 2008. Instrumentos musicales tradicionales de varios grupos de la selva Peruana.
